alert.note: Alert for Greater Greenville; Greenville Mountains; Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 8:59AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Greenville and northwestern Spartanburg Counties through 930 AM EDT... At 859 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles north of Greenville Downtown, or near Travelers Rest, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greenville Downtown, Greer, Taylors, Travelers Rest, Landrum, Inman, Campobello, Paris Mountain State Park, Tigerville and Lake Bowen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
